meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To establish a scheme for compensating persons or their family members in respect of incapacity or death resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) and for purposes connected therewith.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AuthorizedPerson
def.leadIn: authorized person (獲授權人), in relation to construction operations, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorized person appointed or nominated under section 4 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) in respect of the construction operations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no authorized person is appointed under that section, the person appointed in accordance with the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) (Assessment of Levy) Regulations (Cap. 360 sub. leg. A) in respect of the construction operations; (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84. Amended 6 of 2008 s. 4)

subsection.def: carry out (進行) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Added 12 of 2006 s. 84)
Commissioner (處長) means the Commissioner for Labour;
construction contract (建造合約) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Added 3 of 2004 s. 19. Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
construction employer (建造工程聘用人) means an employer as defined in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)
construction operations (建造工程) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)
contract of employment (僱傭合約) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57); (Added 3 of 2004 s. 19)
contractor (承建商) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
Court (法院) means the District Court;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the pneumoconiosis suffered by a person, means the date of a medical examination conducted under this Ordinance from which it is determined that the person is suffering from the disease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the mesothelioma suffered by a person, means the date of a medical examination conducted under this Ordinance from which it is determined that the person is suffering from the disease; (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 4)

def.name: EarliestDiagnosedDate
def.leadIn: earliest diagnosed date (最早診斷日期)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the pneumoconiosis suffered by a person, means the date determined under section 24(1)(a)(i) or (b)(iii) as the date from which it can be said that the person has been suffering from the disease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the mesothelioma suffered by a person, means the date determined under section 24(1)(a)(i) or (b)(iii) as the date from which it can be said that the person has been suffering from the disease; (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 4)

subsection.def: employer (僱主) includes Her Majesty in Her Government of Hong Kong and any body of persons corporate or unincorporated; (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 2)
financial year (財政年度) means the period fixed by the Board under section 29;
further penalty (另加罰款) means the further penalty payable under section 37(1B); (Added 1 of 1983 s. 2)

hospital (醫院) means any hospital within the meaning of the Private Healthcare Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 633) for which a licence under that Ordinance is in force, any hospital maintained by the Government, any military hospital, any public hospital within the meaning of the Hospital Authority Ordinance (Cap. 113) or The Chinese Medicine Hospital of Hong Kong (as defined by section 2(5) of The Chinese Medicine Hospital of Hong Kong Ordinance (15 of 2025)); (Amended 83 of 1991 s. 2; 2 of 2012 s. 3; 34 of 2018 s. 180 and E.R. 5 of 2018; 15 of 2025 s. 3)
incapacity (喪失工作能力) means incapacity resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both); (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to construction operations, means the levy referred to in section 35(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to quarry products, means the levy referred to in section 35(7); (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)

def.name: MedicalExpenses
def.leadIn: medical expenses (醫療費) means all or any of the following expenses incurred in respect of the medical treatment of a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fees of a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner; (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 23)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fees for any surgical or therapeutic treatment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the cost of nursing attendance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the cost of hospital accommodation as an in-patient;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to section 12AA, the cost of medicines, curative materials and medical dressings; (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 23)

subsection.def: medical treatment (醫治), in relation to a person who suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), means medical treatment of any kind whatsoever given to the person by, or under the supervision of, a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner, whether as an in-patient or otherwise; (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 2; 16 of 2006 s. 23; 6 of 2008 s. 4)

def.name: MemberOfTheFamily
def.leadIn: member of the family (家庭成員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a spouse, child, parent, brother or sister, grandparent or grandchild;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any other person who at the date of death of a person was living with that person as a member of the same household and had been so living for the period of 2 years immediately preceding that date; (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 2)

subsection.def: mesothelioma (間皮瘤) means a primary malignant neoplasm of the mesothelial tissue due to dust of asbestos or dust containing asbestos, whether or not such disease is accompanied by tuberculosis of the lungs or by any other disease caused by exposure to such dust; (Added 6 of 2008 s. 4)
notice of assessment (評估通知) means a notice of assessment described in section 35(6); (Added 12 of 2006 s. 84)
partial incapacity (部分喪失工作能力) means incapacity of a degree of less than 100% as determined in accordance with the Fourth Schedule; (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 2)
penalty (罰款) means the penalty payable under section 37(1A); (Added 1 of 1983 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fibrosis of the lungs due to dust of free silica or dust containing free silica, whether or not such disease is accompanied by tuberculosis of the lungs, or any other disease of the pulmonary or respiratory organs caused by exposure to such dust; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: Pneumoconiosis Medical Board (肺塵埃沉着病判傷委員會) means the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board appointed under section 22;

def.name: Quarry
def.leadIn: quarry (石礦場) means any works or system of works the principal purpose of which is to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extract from the earth any rock or stone for commercial purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: crush rock or stone for commercial purposes; (Added 3 of 2004 s. 19)

def.name: QuarryOperator
def.leadIn: quarry operator (石礦場經營人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a Government quarry, the person managing or in charge of that quarry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a quarry other than a Government quarry, the person operating that quarry;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a stone crushing plant, the person operating that stone crushing plant;

subsection.def: quarry products (石礦產品) means all crushed rock, stone and sand extracted from or produced in a quarry; (Added 3 of 2004 s. 19. Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
registered Chinese medicine practitioner (註冊中醫) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549); (Added 16 of 2006 s. 23)
surcharge (附加費) means the surcharge imposable under this Ordinance; (Added 1 of 1983 s. 2)
term contract (固定期合約) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Added 3 of 2004 s. 19. Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
total incapacity (完全喪失工作能力) means incapacity to the degree of 100% as determined in accordance with the Fourth Schedule; (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 2)
total value (總價值), in relation to any construction operations, means the total value of the construction operations as defined in section 39D; (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to any quarry products, means the value of the quarry products as determined under section 39E; (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.def: works order (施工通知) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587). (Added 3 of 2004 s. 19. Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting the generality of the definitions of construction employer and contractor under subsection (1), the following applies for the purposes of construing those terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where a person carries out construction operations for any other person under a contract of employment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the first-mentioned person is appointed as contractor under section 9 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) in respect of the construction operations, he (and not that other person) is the contractor in respect of the construction operations; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the first-mentioned person is not appointed as contractor under section 9 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) in respect of the construction operations, the first-mentioned person is not the contractor in respect of the construction operations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a person carries out construction operations for himself without any arrangement for the carrying out of the construction operations by any other person, the first-mentioned person is both the construction employer and the contractor in respect of the construction operations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where a person carries out construction operations for himself with the assistance, under a contract of employment, of one or more other persons none of whom is appointed as contractor under section 9 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) in respect of the construction operations, the first-mentioned person is both the construction employer and the contractor in respect of the construction operations. (Repealed 54 of 1993 s. 2. Added 12 of 2006 s. 84)

editorialNote.content: For transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by 3 of 2004, please see section 40 of the Construction Industry Levy (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2004 (3 of 2004).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application to the Crown
section.content: This Ordinance shall be binding on the Crown.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, and except where otherwise provided, compensation shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to any person suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), in respect of any incapacity resulting from the above disease or diseases and any pain, suffering and loss of amenities arising from the above disease or diseases; and (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where any such person dies, and subject also to section 17(1), to the members of his family. (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 3)

subsection.content: For a person suffering from pneumoconiosis (whether or not he is also suffering from mesothelioma), compensation in respect of his pneumoconiosis shall be payable under subsection (1) only where the date of diagnosis of his pneumoconiosis or the date of his death occurs on or after 1 January 1981. (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 5)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For a person suffering from mesothelioma (whether or not he is also suffering from pneumoconiosis), compensation in respect of his mesothelioma shall be payable under subsection (1) only where the date of diagnosis of his mesothelioma or the date of his death occurs on or after the date of commencement* of the Pneumoconiosis (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 2008 (6 of 2008). (Added 6 of 2008 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: No compensation shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where ex gratia compensation has been or will be paid by the Government for any incapacity or death resulting from pneumoconiosis diagnosed before 1 January 1981; (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a person in the service of or formerly in the service of the Government who, in consequence of incapacity resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) contracted in the discharge of his duties, is paid pension or gratuity which would not be payable if such incapacity were contracted otherwise than in the discharge of his duties, or in the case of his death, where such pension or gratuity is paid to the members of his family, under any Ordinance or regulation providing for the grant of such pension or gratuity; (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to members of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army; (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to a person in the civil employment of Her Majesty, otherwise than in Her Government of Hong Kong, who has been engaged in a place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply otherwise than to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person resident in Hong Kong for 5 years or more at the date of the notification of his claim under section 14(1)(a), or resident in Hong Kong for less than 5 years at such date if he contracted pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members of the family of a person who was resident in Hong Kong for 5 years or more at the date of his death, or who was resident in Hong Kong for less than 5 years at such date if he contracted pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) in Hong Kong. (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 3. Amended 6 of 2008 s. 5)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (c) of subsection (3), where a person referred to in that paragraph is paid pension or gratuity in respect of either pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma, his entitlement to compensation for the other of the 2 diseases shall not be affected. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), residence in Hong Kong for 5 years or more may be proved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the production to the Commissioner of the identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177) to the person in question; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the production of such other evidence as may be required by the Commissioner.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Compensation for death resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both)

subsection.content: Subject to this section, where a person dies as a result of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) and is survived by any member of his family, the compensation payable shall be a lump sum amount in accordance with Part I of the First Schedule. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 6)

Where compensation has been paid pursuant to section 6 (whether as compensation in respect of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both)) to a person referred to in subsection (1) there shall be deducted from the amount payable under subsection (1) to that person the current value of any amounts so paid as compensation. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 6)
Where the amount otherwise payable under this section would be less than the amount specified in Part V of the First Schedule, the amount payable under this section shall be the amount so specified.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2) the current value of any amounts paid under section 6 shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of any amounts paid within the period of 12 months preceding the person’s death, those amounts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any amounts paid during consecutive 12 month periods preceding the period referred to in paragraph (a), the sum of the amounts paid in any such period increased by reference to the percentage increase (if any) in the Consumer Price Index (A) during the period beginning with the earliest month in the period and ending with the month in which the death occurred.

subsection.def: In this section Consumer Price Index (A) (甲類消費物價指數) means the index of that name compiled by the Commissioner for Census and Statistics.

subsection.content: Where a person who was suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) dies and at the time of his death no certificate had been issued by the Board under section 15B(1) in respect of any of the above diseases, compensation for bereavement shall be payable to the members of his family who survive him. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Compensation payable under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form of a lump sum amount in accordance with Part V of the First Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in addition to any compensation that may be payable under section 5.

section.name: s5B
section.heading: Funeral expenses
section.content: Where a person to whom compensation is payable under section 4 dies as a result of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), the reasonable expenses of the funeral of the deceased person as provided in Part VI of the First Schedule shall be payable by the Board to any person who has incurred such expenses.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Compensation for incapacity subsequent to date of diagnosis

subsection.leadIn: Where incapacity results from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), the compensation payable in respect of the period beginning from the date of diagnosis shall be— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an amount calculated by reference to the degree of such incapacity, as follows—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the period of any total incapacity, a monthly amount in accordance with Part II of the First Schedule; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the period of any partial incapacity, a monthly amount equal to such percentage of the compensation payable in the case of total incapacity as is proportionate to the degree of partial incapacity of the person as determined from time to time under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a monthly amount as specified in Part IIA of the First Schedule as compensation for any pain, suffering and loss of amenities arising from the pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), which amount shall be payable regardless of the degree of such pain, suffering or loss. (Replaced 4 of 1996 s. 4. Amended 6 of 2008 s. 9)

subsection.content: Compensation under this section shall be payable until death.

editorialNote.content: * Please also see section 14 of 4 of 1996.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Compensation for incapacity prior to date of diagnosis

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), where incapacity results from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), the compensation payable in respect of the period from the earliest diagnosed date to the date of diagnosis shall be a lump sum amount in accordance with Part III of the First Schedule, and such amount shall be payable regardless of the degree of incapacity of the person during that period. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has not previously received compensation under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsequently the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board determines on a certain date that the person is suffering from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there are different earliest diagnosed dates for the 2 diseases,

subsection.continued: then for the purposes of calculating the compensation payable under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the earlier of the 2 earliest diagnosed dates shall be taken as the earliest diagnosed date for both diseases under that subsection; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the degree of incapacity of the person at the date of diagnosis resulting from both diseases as determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall be the degree of incapacity for determining the multiplier in paragraph 2 of Part III of the First Schedule. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person has already received compensation under this Ordinance in respect of either pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (the first disease) and the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board subsequently made a determination that the person is also suffering from the other of the 2 diseases (the second disease), then for the purposes of calculating the compensation payable under subsection (1) in respect of the second disease—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the earliest diagnosed date of the second disease shall be taken as the earliest diagnosed date for that disease under that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the degree of incapacity of the person for determining the multiplier in paragraph 2 of Part III of the First Schedule shall be the difference between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the aggregate degree of incapacity of the person resulting from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma at the date of diagnosis of the second disease as determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the degree of incapacity of the person resulting from the first disease as determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board on the basis of the last medical examination of the person under this Ordinance. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 10)

subsection.content: Where the incapacity which results from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) is of such a nature that the person is unable to perform the essential actions of life without the care and attention of another person, in addition to any compensation under the other provisions of this Ordinance, compensation in respect of such care and attention shall be payable under this section. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 11)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Compensation under this section shall not be payable in respect of any continuous period in excess of 1 month for which a person is receiving medical treatment as an in-patient in a hospital unless the Board in its discretion otherwise directs. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 8)
Compensation under this section shall be a monthly amount in accordance with Part IV of the First Schedule.

Subject to this section, a person who suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) and to whom compensation is payable under section 4 shall be entitled to the reasonable medical expenses in respect of such medical treatment as is reasonably necessary in connection with the above disease or diseases suffered by him. (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 24; 6 of 2008 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Medical expenses under this section— (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be payable in accordance with Part I of the Second Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of a disease mentioned in subsection (1) shall be payable only in respect of the period subsequent to the date of diagnosis of that disease; (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 12)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not be payable where the person’s employer, if any, provides a reasonable level of medical treatment free of charge to the person and the person fails, without reasonable excuse, to submit himself for such treatment. (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: Medical expenses shall not cease under subsection (2)(c) to be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of medical treatment given to a person by, or under the supervision of, a registered medical practitioner unless the medical treatment provided free of charge to him by the person’s employer covers medical treatment given by, or under the supervision of, a registered medical practitioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of medical treatment given to a person by, or under the supervision of, a registered Chinese medicine practitioner unless the medical treatment provided free of charge to him by the person’s employer covers medical treatment given by, or under the supervision of, a registered Chinese medicine practitioner. (Added 16 of 2006 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: Medical expenses under this section shall not be payable in respect of medical treatment given in a place outside Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the medical treatment was given lawfully under the law of that place by, or under the supervision of, a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner in that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the medical treatment was medical treatment that might have been given lawfully by him or under his supervision (as the case may be) in the course of his practice in Hong Kong. (Added 16 of 2006 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the other provisions of this section, the medical expenses that a person who suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) and to whom compensation is payable under section 4 is entitled to— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 55)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include the cost of medicines to the extent that the medicines are prescribed medicines for such medical treatment as is reasonably necessary in connection with the above disease or diseases suffered by him; but (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 55)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: do not include the cost of any tonic or substance that is prescribed for the purpose of the maintenance of general health only.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a reference to prescribed medicines is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: medicines prescribed by a registered medical practitioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Chinese herbal medicines or proprietary Chinese medicines prescribed by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner.

subsection.content: A person referred to in subsection (1) is not entitled to any cost of medicines relating to any pharmaceutical product or substance that is required to be registered under the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138) unless it is so registered.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1) is not entitled to any cost of medicines relating to any proprietary Chinese medicine unless the proprietary Chinese medicine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is registered under section 121 of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is deemed to have been registered under section 128 of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is exempted from registration by virtue of section 158(6) of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is exempted from registration by virtue of section 37 of the Chinese Medicines Regulation (Cap. 549 sub. leg. F); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a substance or product that is registered under the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138).

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1) is not entitled to any cost of medicines relating to any Chinese herbal medicine unless the Chinese herbal medicine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is sold to the person concerned by a person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is the holder of a retailer licence issued under section 114 of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is deemed, under section 118(1) of that Ordinance, to have been granted such a licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is sold by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner for the purpose of administering, as described in section 158(2) of that Ordinance, to the person concerned who is a patient under that Chinese medicine practitioner’s direct care.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1) is not entitled to any cost of medicines relating to medicines dispensed pursuant to the same prescription on a second or subsequent occasion unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prescription contains a direction that the medicines are to be dispensed for a stated number of times; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the medicines are dispensed in accordance with that direction.

subsection.content: Where the medical expenses for the medical treatment of a person referred to in subsection (1) include the cost of medicines, the Board may request the person to produce to it the prescription for the medicines and the receipt for the payment of that cost. The person is not entitled to the cost of medicines if the person fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with the request.

subsection.leadIn: A prescription given by a registered medical practitioner and produced for the purposes of subsection (7) must show—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the medical practitioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the patient to whom the prescription is given;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the trade name or pharmacological name and dosage of each medicine prescribed; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the prescription is given.

subsection.leadIn: A prescription given by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner and produced for the purposes of subsection (7) must show—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the Chinese medicine practitioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the patient to whom the prescription is given;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if any Chinese herbal medicine is prescribed, its name and quantity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if any proprietary Chinese medicine registered under section 121 of, or deemed to have been registered under section 128 of, the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549) is prescribed, its product name and dosage;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if any proprietary Chinese medicine exempted from registration by virtue of section 158(6) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549) is prescribed, the name and quantity of each Chinese herbal medicine that is contained in the proprietary Chinese medicine; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the date on which the prescription is given.

subsection.leadIn: A receipt for the payment of the cost of medicines produced for the purpose of subsection (7) must show—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the person by whom the prescribed medicines were sold;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of sale; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name, quantity and price of the prescribed medicines sold.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Chinese herbal medicine specified in Schedule 1 or 2 to the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.text: any other material of herbal, animal or mineral origin customarily used by the Chinese for medicinal purpose;

subsection.def: proprietary Chinese medicine (中成藥) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549).

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Payment of expenses for medical appliances

subsection.content: Subject to this section, a person who suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) and to whom compensation is payable under section 4 shall be entitled to the reasonable expenses of the use or supply of medical appliances where such use or supply is reasonably necessary in connection with any incapacity arising from the above disease or diseases suffered by him. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: Expenses for medical appliances under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be payable only in respect of medical appliances of a kind specified in Part II of the Second Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of a disease mentioned in subsection (1) shall be payable only in respect of the period subsequent to the date of diagnosis of that disease. (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 13)

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Claims for medical expenses and expenses for medical appliances

subsection.content: A person claiming medical expenses under section 12 or claiming expenses for medical appliances under section 12A shall serve on the Board a request in writing for the payment of such expenses together with a receipt for the payment for the treatment or appliances concerned. (Replaced 16 of 2006 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall determine within 21 days of the receipt of a request made under subsection (1) whether or not the expenses referred to in the request are payable under this Ordinance and shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a claim for medical expenses— (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pay to the person, on the date that payment of compensation determined under section 15B is next due to that person, such amount as it determines to be payable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the amount so determined is less than the amount specified in the request under subsection (1), inform the person in writing of its determination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a claim for expenses for medical appliances—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: inform the person in writing of its determination and the amount of such expenses, if any, that are payable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within a further 7 days pay the amount from the Fund to the person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of determining a person’s claim under subsection (2), the Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the person to inform the Board in writing, within a reasonable period of time as specified by the Board, whether any medical treatment was given in Hong Kong or outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may require the registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner whom the person claims to be the one that gave the person medical treatment to inform the Board in writing, within a reasonable period of time as specified by the Board, whether he did give the medical treatment to the person, whether the medical treatment was given in Hong Kong or outside Hong Kong, and whether the medical treatment was medical treatment that met the requirements in section 12(4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may seek advice, from such persons as in the opinion of the Board may be competent for the purposes, as to whether any medical treatment was medical treatment that met the requirements in section 12(4);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may require the person to submit to the Board, within a reasonable period of time as specified by the Board, a medical report that meets the requirements in subsection (4);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: may seek from the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board or a registered medical practitioner an opinion as to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether any medical treatment received by the person from a registered medical practitioner was reasonably necessary in connection with the pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) suffered by him; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whether the use by or supply to the person of any medical appliance was reasonably necessary in connection with incapacity arising as a result of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both); and (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 56)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: may seek from a registered Chinese medicine practitioner an opinion as to whether any medical treatment received by the person from a registered Chinese medicine practitioner was reasonably necessary in connection with the pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) suffered by him. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 56)

subsection.leadIn: The medical report referred to in subsection (3)(d) shall be prepared—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a claim for medical expenses, by the registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner who attends the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a claim for expenses for medical appliances, by the registered medical practitioner who attends the person,

subsection.continued: and shall set out the diagnosis, particulars of the medical treatment or medical appliances concerned, and such other particulars as the Board may reasonably require. (Replaced 16 of 2006 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: Where under subsection (3)(e) or (f) the Board seeks an opinion from the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board, a registered medical practitioner or a registered Chinese medicine practitioner in respect of a person’s claim, the Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may furnish the medical report submitted by the person under subsection (3)(d) to the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board, medical practitioner or Chinese medicine practitioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may require the person to appear before the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board, medical practitioner or Chinese medicine practitioner for the purposes of answering queries reasonably related to the medical expenses or expenses for medical appliances claimed. (Added 16 of 2006 s. 26)

subsection.content: The period that begins on the day a requirement is imposed under subsection (3)(a), (b) or (d) or (5)(b) and ends on the day the requirement is complied with shall not count towards the period of 21 days referred to in subsection (2). (Added 16 of 2006 s. 26)

Where a person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed under subsection (3)(d) or (5)(b), the Board may determine that the person is not eligible for the medical expenses or expenses for medical appliances claimed. (Added 16 of 2006 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: A person who submits a medical report as required under subsection (3)(d)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may claim from the Board the expenses paid by him as the fees charged by his registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner for preparing the report; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall support the claim by producing the receipt for payment of those expenses.

subsection.continued: The Board shall pay to the person those expenses to the extent that they are reasonably incurred. (Added 16 of 2006 s. 26)

subsection.content: Nothing in this Ordinance shall diminish or extinguish any right to damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both).

Subject to subsection (4), where any person has paid damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) pursuant to a judgment of any court in Hong Kong, he shall be entitled to recover from the Fund the amount of such damages and interest thereon together with the amount of any costs ordered by the court to be paid by that person.

Subject to subsection (4), where any person is liable to pay damages or interest in the circumstances described in subsection (2), at any time before the damages or interest are paid, the person entitled to the damages or the person liable to pay them may apply to the Board for the amount of such damages, interest and costs to be paid from the Fund to the person entitled to the damages in satisfaction of the judgment.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), where any person has, with the written consent of the Board, paid an amount in settlement of a claim for damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) or for costs and interest in respect of such a claim (whether by money paid into court which has been accepted in accordance with Order 22 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) or otherwise), he shall be entitled to recover from the Fund the amount of such payment. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 11. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), where any person has undertaken to pay an amount in settlement of a claim for damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) or for costs and interest in respect of such a claim (whether by payment into court in an action for such damages or otherwise), the Board may, on such conditions as it sees fit, pay such amount from the Fund. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsections (2), (3), (3A) and (3B), where a claim is made against any person for damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), the Fund shall not be liable to pay such damages or any costs— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the person claimed against has, within 30 days of the receipt of the claim, given written notice thereof to the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the person claimed against defends the claim diligently or, where the Board takes over and conducts the defence or settlement of the claim, assists the Board in so defending or settling the claim; (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 11)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: where the Board has not taken over the defence of the claim, if the person claimed against fails repeatedly and without good cause to comply with any reasonable request of the Board for information concerning the conduct of the defence of the claim; (Added 54 of 1993 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the person claimed against has, without the written consent of the Board, made any admission of liability or offered or promised to pay any damages or costs.

subsection.content: Where any claim is made against any person for damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), then, subject to subsection (4), the Board may take over and conduct in the name of that person the defence or settlement of the claim and settle the claim on his behalf.

Where any damages, interest or costs have been paid by or recovered from the Fund under subsection (2), (3), (3A), (3B) or (5), the Board shall be subrogated to all such rights and remedies that the person who has paid, or who was liable to pay, damages, may have against any other person in respect of the liability for such damages; and the Board shall be entitled to enforce such rights and remedies in the name of the Board.
In assessing damages to be paid for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), the court shall take into account any compensation that has been paid or is payable.

Where after the commencement** of the Pneumoconiosis (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (54 of 1993), a person is awarded damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis in a judgment of a court in Hong Kong the whole of the person’s entitlement to compensation or other payment under this Ordinance in respect of the pneumoconiosis, other than compensation in respect of the pneumoconiosis payable prior to the date of such judgment, shall by virtue of this section be extinguished. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 11)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.content: Where after the commencement# of the Pneumoconiosis (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 2008 (6 of 2008), a person is awarded damages for death or disability resulting from mesothelioma in a judgment of a court in Hong Kong the whole of the person’s entitlement to compensation or other payment under this Ordinance in respect of the mesothelioma, other than compensation in respect of the mesothelioma payable prior to the date of such judgment, shall by virtue of this section be extinguished. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 15)

subsection.def: In this section death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) (肺塵埃沉着病或間皮瘤(或兩者)引致的死亡或殘疾) means death, disability, pain and suffering or any other loss or damage of any kind resulting from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both); and death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis (肺塵埃沉着病引致的死亡或殘疾) and death or disability resulting from mesothelioma (間皮瘤引致的死亡或殘疾) shall be construed accordingly. (Replaced 6 of 2008 s. 15)

section.name: s13A
section.heading: Payments in addition to compensation
section.content: Amounts payable under sections 5B, 12 and 12A shall be payable in addition to any compensation payable under this Ordinance.

section.name: s13B
section.heading: Certain sections do not confer additional compensation to persons with both diseases
section.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is suffering from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or the members of his family is or are entitled to compensation or other payment under section 5, 5A, 5B, 6(1)(b) or 11,

section.continued: the amount of compensation or other payment payable to the person or the members of his family under each of those sections shall not be higher than the amount the person or the members of his family would have been entitled to under that section had the person been only suffering from one of the above diseases.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Claims for and Payment of Compensation

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) and wishes to claim compensation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) dies (whether as a result of the above disease or diseases or from a cause other than the above disease or diseases) and any member of his family wishes to claim compensation,

subsection.continued: the person, or the member of his family, as the case may be, shall as soon as practicable notify the Commissioner of his claim in such form as the Commissioner may specify. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has been determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to be suffering from either pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person subsequently suffers from the other of the 2 diseases and he wishes to make a further claim for compensation for that other disease,

subsection.continued: instead of notifying the Commissioner under this section in respect of the further claim, he shall request the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to conduct a further medical examination, and section 23A applies to the request accordingly. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of a notice under subsection (1), the Commissioner shall, subject to subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: request the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to examine the person for the purpose of determining the matters referred to in section 24(1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the death of a person, request the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to make a determination under section 24(2) in respect of the deceased person.

subsection.content: Where the Commissioner is satisfied that the claimant is a person other than a person referred to in section 4(4), he may decline to act under subsection (2), but shall in such case inform the claimant in writing of his decision and the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Commissioner to determine certain matters and issue certificate

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner receives a certificate issued by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board under section 24 in respect of a claim under section 14(1), and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate states that the person claiming compensation suffers from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) or (in the case of the death of a person) that the deceased person suffered from the above disease or diseases at the time of his death; and (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a claim under section 14(1)(a), the person claiming compensation has not previously received compensation under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall determine the matters set out in subsection (2) and shall issue a certificate stating his determination as to those matters.

subsection.leadIn: The matters to be determined by the Commissioner and stated in a certificate issued under subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the claimant is a person referred to in section 4(4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a claim under section 14(1)(b), the names of the members of the family to whom compensation is payable pursuant to section 17, and the relationship of each such member of the family to the deceased person.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate issued under subsection (1) shall be sent to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person or any member of the family claiming compensation under section 14(1) and any person named in the certificate for the purposes of subsection (2)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Board.

subsection.leadIn: An application by any person for a review pursuant to section 19D of a decision of the Commissioner as to any matter required to be determined by the Commissioner and stated in a certificate issued by the Commissioner under this section shall be brought—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a claim made under section 14(1)(a), within 14 days after the person’s receipt of the Commissioner’s certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a claim made under section 14(1)(b), within 3 months after the person’s receipt of the Commissioner’s certificate,

subsection.continued: or within such longer period as the Commissioner may allow.

subsection.content: Following his review of a decision referred to in subsection (4), the Commissioner shall issue to the persons referred to in subsection (3) and to the applicant for the review a certificate stating the result of the review.

section.name: s15A
section.heading: Interim payments of compensation to family members

subsection.leadIn: Where in the case of a claim by a member of the family of a person who has died—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate has been issued by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board stating that the person’s death resulted from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both); and (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 19)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate has been issued by the Commissioner stating that the claimant is a person referred to in section 4(4)(b),

subsection.continued: the Board shall, subject to subsection (3), make interim payments from the Fund of an amount equal to the average monthly earnings as defined in Part VII of the First Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Interim payments under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be payable to the members of the family named in the certificate pursuant to section 15(2)(b) and shall be payable to such members in the same proportion as if it were compensation to which section 17(1) applied; (Amended 4 of 1996 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall be payable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as to the first such payment, within 21 days after receipt by the Board of the Commissioner’s certificate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to each subsequent payment, within 30 days of the preceding payment becoming payable;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: shall cease to be payable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: upon the Board receiving notice that an application has been made for review of the Commissioner’s decision as to any matter referred to in section 15(2)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: upon the expiration of the period allowed under section 15(4) for an application for review,

subsection.leadIn: Any amount paid from the Fund pursuant to subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be deducted from the compensation payable under this Ordinance to the members of the family;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be recoverable from the person to whom it is paid, unless such payment has been obtained by fraud or other improper means.

section.name: s15B
section.heading: Board to determine amount of compensation

subsection.leadIn: Where a certificate is issued by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner under section 15(1) in respect of a claim under section 14(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board under section 24(4) in respect of a medical examination under section 23A,

subsection.continued: the Board shall determine the amounts of compensation, if any, payable to the person or members of the family and shall issue to the claimant, and (in the case of the death of a person) to any member of the family named in the Commissioner’s certificate, a certificate showing the calculation of those amounts.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate referred to in subsection (1) shall be issued by the Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 14 days after the expiry of the time limited for the making of an application for review of the decision of the Commissioner or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board as to any matter referred to in the certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where any such application for review has been made, within 14 days after receipt by the Board of the certificate of the Commissioner issued under section 15(5) or of the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board issued under section 24(6).

subsection.content: An application by any person for a review pursuant to section 19D of a decision of the Board as to any matter required under this section to be determined by the Board and stated in a certificate issued by the Board shall be made within 14 days after the person’s receipt of the certificate, or within such longer period as the Commissioner may allow.

subsection.leadIn: Following its review of any decision referred to in subsection (3), the Board shall issue a certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the original determination of amounts is confirmed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stating the revised determination of the amounts of compensation and showing the calculation of those amounts.

subsection.content: The Board shall pay from the Fund compensation within 7 days after payment is due.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), and subject to subsection (3), payment of compensation to any person is due—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an initial payment of an amount shown in a certificate issued by the Board under section 15B(1), on the 14th day after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the issue of that certificate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where an application for review of a decision of the Board as referred to in section 15B(3) has been made, the issue of the Board’s certificate under section 15B(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of monthly payments of compensation pursuant to section 6 or for care and attention, subsequent to the initial payments of such compensation, on the last day of the month for which the payment is made.

subsection.leadIn: In respect of a claim under section 14(1)(b) by the member of the family of a person who has died—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where an application has been made under section 15(4) for a review of a decision of the Commissioner as to any matter referred to in section 15(2)(b), payment of compensation shall not be due until such review, or any appeal in respect of such matter, has been finally determined, or any time allowed for the bringing of such appeal has expired and no appeal has been commenced; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where no such application has been made, payment of compensation is due—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the 14th day after the issue of a certificate by the Board under section 15B(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where an application for review of any decision of the Board under section 15B(1) has been made, on the 14th day after the issue of the Board’s certificate under section 15B(4).

subsection.content: Where the period in respect of which the compensation pursuant to section 6 or for care and attention is payable is less than 1 month, the amount of compensation payable shall be pro rata to the period. (Amended 4 of 1996 s. 6)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Persons entitled to payment of compensation

subsection.content: The compensation shall be payable to or for the benefit of a person, or, in the case of the death of a person, to or for the benefit of the members of his family as provided by this Ordinance. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: Compensation payable to the members of the family of a deceased person shall be paid in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the deceased leaves a spouse or cohabitee but does not leave—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a child; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any member of family who had been residing with him for the period of 2 years immediately preceding his death,

paragraph.continued: the compensation shall be paid to the spouse or cohabitee or both;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the deceased leaves a spouse or cohabitee and a child or children, whether or not persons mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii) also survive, the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as to 75%, to the spouse or cohabitee or both;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to 25%, to the child or children;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the deceased leaves no child but does leave a spouse or cohabitee and one or more persons mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii), the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as to 75%, to the spouse or cohabitee or both;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the persons mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii) include one parent or both parents (whether or not other members of the family also survive), to the parent or parents; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the deceased leaves no parent, to the persons mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the deceased leaves a child or children but no spouse or cohabitee, the compensation shall be paid to the child or children;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the deceased leaves no spouse or cohabitee and no child, the compensation shall be paid to one or other of the following persons mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the parents of the deceased; but if no parent survives; then

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to the brothers and sisters of the deceased; but if no brother or sister survives; then

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to the grandparents of the deceased; but if no grandparent survives; then

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: to the grandchildren of the deceased; but if no grandchild survives; then

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: to the other members of the family of the deceased.

subsection.content: Where compensation is payable to 2 or more persons under the same paragraph or subparagraph of subsection (1) (including any case where compensation is payable to both the spouse and the cohabitee of a deceased person), equal amounts of compensation shall be paid to each such person.
No compensation shall be payable to a member of the family of a deceased person except as provided in this section.

subsection.leadIn: Any other compensation payable under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be paid by the Board to the person entitled to the compensation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the compensation is payable under section 6, 10 or 11, may be paid by the Board to the Commissioner, who shall invest such compensation for the benefit of the person entitled to the compensation, in such manner as the Commissioner thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Board may pay from the Fund an amount direct to a person or a member of a person’s family on account of a claim which is pending settlement or determination, and the Board may deduct the payment or part of it from the compensation payable under this Ordinance to the person or member of his family.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Limitation of time for claiming compensation

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a claim for compensation or other payment under Part II in respect of the death of a person shall be made within 24 months after the date of such death. (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 18)

Notwithstanding subsection (1), the Commissioner or the Board, as the case may be, may receive any claim for compensation or other payment in any case after the expiry of the period specified in that subsection if he or it is satisfied that there was reasonable excuse for the failure to make a claim within such period. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 18)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Board to pay compensation to Government in certain circumstances
section.content: Where a person in the service of, or formerly in the service of, the Government is paid pension for incapacity, or in the case of the death of such person who was suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) where pension is paid to the members of his family, under any Ordinance providing for the grant of such pension, the Board shall pay to the Government from the Fund a sum of money equal to the amount of money that would have been payable as compensation had that person not been disqualified to claim compensation by reason of section 4(3)(c).

section.name: s19A
section.heading: Verification by Board of persons receiving compensation

subsection.content: Where the Board has reason to believe that a person entitled to receive any monthly payment of compensation for incapacity or care and attention to be paid by the Board has died, it may withhold such payment until it has ascertained whether or not the person is still alive.

The Board may, by notice sent by registered post to the last known address of any person who is entitled to receive compensation in the form of monthly payments, require such person to appear before the Board in person and to furnish proof of identity, and where a person fails to comply with such a requirement the Board may, unless the person has furnished to the Board a reasonable excuse for his failure to so comply, withhold further payment of compensation until the Board’s requirement is complied with.

section.name: s19B
section.heading: Excess payments of compensation
section.leadIn: Where the Board has paid to any person an amount of compensation in excess of the amount to which he is entitled under this Ordinance, the Board may deduct such amount of excess payment from any compensation payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to that person for incapacity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in consequence of the death of that person.

section.name: s19C
section.heading: Claims for compensation etc. under this Ordinance
section.content: Nothing in this Ordinance shall be construed as providing for a claim to be made in respect of compensation or other payment under this Ordinance except in the manner provided in this Part.

subsection.content: Subject to this section, any person who is dissatisfied with a decision of the Commissioner, the Board or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board made in the exercise of powers conferred under this Ordinance may apply to the Commissioner, the Board or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board (as the case may be) for a review of that decision.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section for a review of any decision shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made by notice in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the grounds upon which the decision should be reviewed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where any period is specified in this Ordinance for the making of an application for a review in any case, within the period so specified; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where no such period is specified, within 1 month of receipt by the applicant of notice of such decision, or within such further period as the Commissioner may allow.

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under subsection (1) the Commissioner, the Board or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall review the decision in question and, after giving the applicant and any other interested person the opportunity of making written submissions, may affirm, vary or rescind the decision and shall give notice of his or its decision to the applicant and such other person.

def.name: InterestedPerson
def.leadIn: In subsection (3), interested person (有利害關係的人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person to whom notice of the decision under review was given;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other person as may be specified in regulations made under section 47.

subsection.content: Subject to this section, an appeal shall lie to the Court from any decision of the Commissioner, the Board or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 22)

Except with the leave of the Court (which shall not be granted unless in the opinion of the Court some substantial question of law is involved in the appeal) no appeal shall lie if the amount in dispute is less than $5,000. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.leadIn: No appeal shall lie from any decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless an application for review under section 19D in respect of that decision has first been determined; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case in which an order has been made by the Court giving effect to an agreement come to by the parties. (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), no appeal shall lie from any decision after the expiration of 6 months from the determination of a review in relation to that decision. (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 22)

Subject to subsection (6), no appeal shall lie from any decision of the Commissioner as to a matter referred to in section 15(2)(b) after the expiration of 1 month from the determination of a review in relation to that decision. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 22)
The Court may, if it thinks fit, extend the time within which to appeal under this section notwithstanding that that time has elapsed. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 22)

On an appeal under this section, the Court may confirm, vary or reverse any decision of the Commissioner, the Board or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board, and may make any further order, including any order as to costs, as it thinks fit. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.def: In this Part, decision (決定) includes a determination, and the power conferred on the Court under subsection (7) to confirm, vary or reverse any decision includes the power to determine the amount of compensation or other moneys payable under this Ordinance. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.content: The Board may, for the purpose of the protection of the Fund, and on such terms as it sees fit, enter into a compromise of any appeal or proposed appeal and may make any payment from the Fund for that purpose. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 22)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Power of Commissioner etc. to submit questions of law

subsection.content: The Commissioner, Board, Pneumoconiosis Medical Board or Court may, if he or it thinks fit, submit any question of law for the decision of the Court of Appeal. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 23)

Such submission shall be made in such form and in such manner as if it were a submission under section 22 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282), and any rules of court made under that Ordinance relating to submissions under that section shall apply, with such changes as may be necessary, to a submission under this section.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Appointment of Pneumoconiosis Medical Board
section.leadIn: The Director of Health shall appoint a board to be known as the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board which shall consist of— (Amended L.N. 76 of 1989)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 registered medical practitioners; and (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 27)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Occupational Health Consultant, or a Senior Occupational Health Officer or an Occupational Health Officer. (Amended L.N. 248 of 1982; 54 of 1993 s. 24)

subsection.content: The Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall, if requested under this Ordinance to conduct a medical examination of any person, give notice in writing to such person requiring him to submit himself to a medical examination on such date and at such time and place as is specified in the notice. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 25)
Where a person who receives a notice under subsection (1) is employed, he shall as soon as possible notify his employer (if any) of the date, time and place for the medical examination.

For the purpose of attending to undergo a medical examination an employer shall grant to the person referred to in this section the necessary leave of absence from work and the employer shall pay the person the wages or salary in respect of such absence from work or the wages or salary he would have earned if he had worked during such period.
Any employer who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 25; E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A person who has previously been determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to be suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) resulting in partial incapacity and who is in receipt of compensation under this Ordinance may, subject to this section, request the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to conduct a further medical examination for the purpose of determining— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether there has been any increase in the degree of his incapacity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if he has previously been determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board to be suffering from either pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma only) whether he is also suffering from the other of the 2 diseases (referred to in this section as the second disease) and whether there has been any increase in the degree of his incapacity.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a request for a further medical examination for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) shall not be made until after the expiry of a period of 21 months from the date of the last such examination or an examination under section 23(1) or 49(5); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the further medical examination shall be conducted by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board within 6 months after the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a request for a further medical examination for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) is supported by— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 57)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an opinion given by a registered medical practitioner attending the person to the effect that the person’s health has deteriorated such that total incapacity or death is likely to occur before the period of 21 months referred to in subsection (2) has elapsed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an opinion given by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner attending the person to the effect that the person’s health has deteriorated such that death is likely to occur before the period of 21 months referred to in subsection (2) has elapsed; and (Replaced 16 of 2006 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board considers that the deterioration in the person’s health is such that an early examination is warranted,

subsection.continued: the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall conduct the further medical examination as soon as practicable.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: A request for a further medical examination for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) shall not be made unless the request is supported by an opinion given by a registered medical practitioner attending the person to the effect that the person is suffering from the second disease, and on receipt of such a request and such an opinion, the further medical examination shall be conducted by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board as soon as practicable. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 6(1)(a)(ii), a determination of the degree of incapacity by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board under section 24(1)(b)(i) on the basis of a further medical examination conducted under this section shall be treated as having been made— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a request for a further medical examination for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) made at any time during the period of 6 months beginning on the expiry of the period of 21 months referred to in subsection (2)(a), on a date 2 years after the date of the last such examination or the date of diagnosis, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, on the date on which the request under this section is made.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Determination of incapacity or cause of death

subsection.leadIn: Where a person submits himself to a medical examination in accordance with section 23(1), the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an examination for the purposes of section 14(2), determine whether the person is suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), and if so— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 22)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: determine the date from which it can be said that the person has been so suffering;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: determine in accordance with the Fourth Schedule the degree of incapacity resulting from the above disease or diseases; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: determine whether the person is unable to perform the essential actions of life without the care and attention of another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an examination for the purposes of section 23A—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: determine whether the degree of incapacity as determined in accordance with the Fourth Schedule has increased since the date of the last examination under section 23(1) or 23A, and if so the extent of such increase;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: determine whether the person has, since the date of his last examination under section 23(1) or 23A, become unable to perform the essential actions of life without the care and attention of another person; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: (if the examination is conducted for the purposes of section 23A(1)(b)) determine whether the person suffers from the second disease referred to in that section and the date from which it can be said that the person has been so suffering. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 22)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Where a person is suffering from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma, the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall, in determining the degree of incapacity of the person, take into account the effect of both diseases on the person as a whole, and in any event, the degree of incapacity determined in respect of the person shall not exceed 100%. (Added 6 of 2008 s. 22)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of death, the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall, at the request of the Commissioner, determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if no determination has previously been made under subsection (1)(a) that the person was suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma, whether the person was suffering from the above disease or diseases at the time of his death; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any person previously determined under subsection (1)(a) to be suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), or determined under paragraph (a) to have been suffering from pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) at the time of his death, whether the person’s death resulted from the above disease or diseases. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 22)

subsection.content: A determination by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board, if not unanimous, shall be that of the majority of the members of the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall issue a certificate of its determination made under this section to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person, or in the case of the death of a person, to the member of his family, who has claimed under section 14(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except in the case of a determination under subsection (1)(b), the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Board.

subsection.content: An application by any person for a review pursuant to section 19D of any decision of the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board as to any matter required to be determined by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board under this section shall be made within 14 days after the receipt of the certificate issued by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board under subsection (4) or within such further period as the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board may allow.

subsection.leadIn: Following its review of any decision referred to in subsection (5), the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall issue to the persons referred to in subsection (4) a certificate stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the original determination is confirmed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a revised determination.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Establishment of Pneumoconiosis Compensation Fund Board

subsection.content: There is hereby established a board, to be known as the Pneumoconiosis Compensation Fund Board.
The Board shall consist of not more than 10 members appointed by the Chief Executive of whom not more than 4 shall be public officers. (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 38)
The Third Schedule shall have effect with respect to the Board.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Functions and powers of the Board

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall have the following functions—
