paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to administer the Fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make recommendations to the Government with respect to the rate of levy; (Amended 65 of 1987 s. 2)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: to conduct and finance educational, publicity, research and other programmes to prevent pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma and to conduct and finance programmes for the rehabilitation of persons suffering from the above diseases; (Added 65 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 54 of 1993 s. 28; 4 of 1996 s. 7; 6 of 2008 s. 23)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: to administer funds received from the Government and designated by the Government as ex gratia payments to persons diagnosed before 1 January 1981 to be suffering from pneumoconiosis; and (Added 54 of 1993 s. 28. Amended 6 of 2008 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to perform such other duties as are imposed on it by this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the better carrying out of the functions of the Board and may in particular, but without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold, acquire or lease all kinds of property, whether movable or immovable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), sell or otherwise dispose of all kinds of property whether movable or immovable;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enter into, assign or accept the assignment of, and vary or rescind any contract or obligation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), meet expenditure on any item shown in the approved estimates of expenditure of the Board, borrow or otherwise raise money on such security as may be necessary, and for that purpose, charge all or any of the property of the Board;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: make charges for the use of any facility or service provided by the Board.

subsection.content: The Board shall not sell or otherwise dispose of land granted at nil premium by the Government except with the prior approval of the Chief Executive. (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 38)

Except with the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, no sum shall be borrowed or otherwise raised under subsection (2)(d) which itself, or together with all other sums previously borrowed or otherwise raised under that subsection and still outstanding, exceeds, or in the aggregate exceeds, 10 per cent of the approved total estimated expenditure for the current financial year.

subsection.leadIn: There is hereby established a Pneumoconiosis Compensation Fund which shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any moneys recovered by way of levy, surcharge, penalty and further penalty; (Amended 1 of 1983 s. 3)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: any moneys recovered by the Board from a third party in accordance with section 40A; (Added 54 of 1993 s. 29)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any moneys provided by the Government for the purposes of the Fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other moneys lawfully received by the Board for its purposes.

subsection.content: The Fund shall be vested in the Board.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Payments by the Board from the Fund
section.leadIn: The Board shall pay from the Fund the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compensation under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: fees charged by the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board, a registered medical practitioner or a registered Chinese medicine practitioner for, or in connection with, giving an opinion for the purposes of section 12B; (Added 16 of 2006 s. 29)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: expenses paid as the fees charged by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner for preparing a medical report for the purposes of section 12B; (Added 16 of 2006 s. 29)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: damages, interest and costs payable or settled under section 13;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: any sums, including costs, payable in respect of an appeal, or the compromise of an appeal or a proposed appeal, under section 20; (Added 54 of 1993 s. 30)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any sums payable under section 19;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: funeral expenses payable under section 5B; (Added 54 of 1993 s. 30)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: medical expenses and expenses for medical appliances; (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 30. Amended 16 of 2006 s. 29)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: medical examination fees for medical examinations under section 23;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: expenses incurred by the Board for the purposes of section 26(1)(ba); (Added 65 of 1987 s. 3)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: expenses incurred by the Board for the purposes of this Ordinance, including fees charged by the Financial Secretary for services provided to the Board by the Government; (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 30)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any other sums payable by the Board by virtue of or under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: In each financial year, before a date to be appointed by the Chief Executive, the Board shall submit to the Chief Executive a programme of its proposed activities and estimates of its income and expenditure for the next financial year.
The Board may, from time to time, with the prior approval of the Chief Executive, fix a period to be the financial year of the Board.

The Chief Executive may approve or reject the programme and estimates submitted to him under subsection (1) and, in the case of a rejection, may require the Board to resubmit, within such time as he may direct, the programme or estimates, or both, modified in such manner as he may direct. (Added 65 of 1987 s. 4)
The Board shall comply with any requirement under subsection (3). (Added 65 of 1987 s. 4)

The Board may from time to time vary the estimates submitted under subsection (1), even after their approval by the Chief Executive, and if it does so shall inform the Chief Executive in writing of the details of the variation. (Added 65 of 1987 s. 4)
The Board shall open and maintain an account with a bank approved by the Director of Accounting Services.
The Board shall pay all moneys received by it into the account referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Investment of funds
section.leadIn: All funds of the Board that are not immediately required may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deposited on fixed term or call deposit or in a savings account in any bank nominated by the Financial Secretary either generally or in any particular case, for that purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, invested in such investments as the Board thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Board shall maintain proper accounts and records of all income and expenditure.

After the end of each financial year, the Board shall cause to be prepared statements of income and expenditure during the previous financial year and of the assets and liabilities of the Board on the last day thereof.
The Board may write off the whole or any part of any debt due to the Board which it reasonably considers irrecoverable.
Any write-off under subsection (1) shall take effect for accounting purposes alone and shall not extinguish any right of the Board to recover the debt which has been written off.

The Board shall appoint auditors, who shall be entitled at any time to have access to all books of account vouchers and other financial records of the Board and to require such information and explanations thereof as they may think fit.
The auditors shall audit the statements prepared under section 32(2) and shall report thereon to the Board.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Statements and reports to be laid on table of Legislative Council

subsection.content: The Board shall, within 6 months after the end of each financial year or such further time as the Chief Executive may in any particular year allow, submit to the Chief Executive a report on the activities of the Board and copies of the statements prepared under section 32(2) and the report made under section 33(2).
The Chief Executive shall cause the reports and statements received by him under subsection (1) to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.
A levy at the rate specified in Division 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 5 is to be imposed in respect of construction operations carried out in Hong Kong.
The levy referred to in subsection (1) is to be assessed and paid according to this Ordinance.
Construction operations the total value of which does not exceed the amount specified in Part 1 of Schedule 5 are not liable to the levy.
Subject to subsection (5), the levy is payable by a contractor of any construction operations which are subject to the payment of a levy.
A contractor is liable to make a payment pursuant to subsection (4) only if the Board gives him a notice of assessment.
A notice of assessment shall be in writing and shall specify the amount of the levy payable by the contractor.
A levy at the rate specified in Division 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 5 is to be imposed in respect of quarry products.
The levy referred to in subsection (7) is to be assessed and paid according to this Ordinance.
The levy is payable by the quarry operator of the quarry from or in which the quarry products are extracted or produced.
The Legislative Council may by resolution amend Schedule 5.
Any amendment to Schedule 5 shall come into effect on the expiry of the specified period.

Despite the coming into effect of any amendment to Part 1 or Division 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 5, Schedule 5 as it was before such amendment continues to apply to the construction operations to which this subsection applies.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies to the following construction operations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: construction operations the tender for which had been submitted to the construction employer before the expiry of the specified period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other construction operations carried out under a construction contract, if the contract had been entered into before the expiry of the specified period or the construction operations had commenced before the expiry of that period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: construction operations other than those referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b), that had commenced before the expiry of the specified period.

subsection.def: In this section, specified period (指明期間), in relation to a particular amendment made under subsection (1), means the period of 30 days after the publication in the Gazette of that amendment.

subsection.content: The amount of levy, or of any surcharge that may be imposed in such circumstances as may be prescribed, shall be paid by the contractor or quarry operator, as the case may be, to the Board within such time as may be prescribed.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If the amount of the levy or surcharge is not fully paid within such time as may be prescribed under subsection (1) the contractor or quarry operator, as the case may be, shall be liable to pay, in addition, a penalty of 5 per cent of the amount unpaid. (Added 1 of 1983 s. 4. Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If the amount of the levy or surcharge including any penalty payable under subsection (1A) is not fully paid within 3 months after the expiry of such period as may be prescribed under subsection (1) the contractor or quarry operator, as the case may be, shall be liable to pay, in addition, a further penalty of $1,000 or 5% of the amount unpaid, whichever is the greater. (Added 1 of 1983 s. 4. Amended 54 of 1993 s. 32; 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: The Board may waive or refund the whole or any part of a levy, surcharge, penalty or further penalty if it considers it fair and reasonable to do so in the special circumstances of a particular case. (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: If an amount waived under subsection (1C) has already been paid to the Board, the Board shall refund it. (Added 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.content: If, in respect of any construction operations, the Board receives more than the proper amount of the levy due to more than one contractor paying the whole or part of amount due, the Board shall refund the excess to the contractor entitled to the refund. (Added 12 of 2006 s. 84)

Payment shall be made in accordance with subsections (1), (1A) and (1B) notwithstanding that the contractor or quarry operator may wish to make an objection under the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) (Assessment of Levy) Regulations (Cap. 360 sub. leg. A). (Amended 1 of 1983 s. 4; 12 of 2006 s. 84; 6 of 2008 s. 24)
Any amount of levy or surcharge, including the amount of any penalty or further penalty, due and payable under this Ordinance shall be recoverable as a debt due to the Board. (Amended 1 of 1983 s. 5)

An action under subsection (1) may be brought in the Court notwithstanding that the amount due exceeds the civil jurisdiction of the Court as may from time to time be determined under the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

Where an amount due under subsection (1) is within the jurisdiction of the Small Claims Tribunal established under the Small Claims Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 338), an action under that subsection may be brought in that Tribunal. (Added 54 of 1993 s. 33)

section.name: s39
section.heading: Evasion of payment of levy
section.content: Any person who is knowingly concerned in, or in the taking of steps with a view to, the fraudulent evasion of the payment of a levy, whether due from him or from any other person, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 or 20 times the amount of levy that was or was intended to be evaded by his conduct, whichever is the greater.

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to construction operations that are carried out both—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person who occupies a domestic unit or part of a domestic unit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the sole or principal purpose of decorating, altering, repairing, maintaining or renovating the unit or any part of the unit.

subsection.def: In this section, domestic unit (住用單位) means any premises used or intended to be used solely or principally for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a person is regarded as a person who occupies a domestic unit if he intends to occupy the unit.

section.name: s39B
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive in Council to exclude certain construction operations from application of this Ordinance

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, exclude any construction operations from the application of this Ordinance.
An order under subsection (1) may exclude particular construction operations or a type or description of construction operations.
An order under subsection (1) may specify the circumstances in which or the purposes for which the exclusion applies.

part.name: P7A
part.heading: Value of Construction Operations and Quarry Products, etc.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to any construction operations, the value of the construction operations is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the construction operations are the subject of a construction contract—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the consideration attributable to the construction operations, that is stated in the contract; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the consideration attributable to the construction operations, that is ascertainable by reference to the contract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the reasonable consideration to be expected in the open market for the carrying out of the construction operations.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1)(a), if the consideration attributable to any construction operations as determined in accordance with that subsection is below the reasonable consideration to be expected in the open market for the carrying out of the construction operations, the consideration of the construction operations is to be the reasonable consideration referred to in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the Board may, in a particular case, have regard to any or all of the following matters when ascertaining the reasonable consideration to be expected in the open market for the carrying out of the construction operations concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cost or value of materials used in the construction operations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cost or value of time, work and labour involved in the construction operations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the equipment used in the construction operations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such overhead costs incurred in relation to the construction operations as the Board considers reasonable;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the reasonable profit to be expected in the open market for the carrying out of the construction operations;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other factors that the Board considers appropriate.

def.name: TotalValue
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, total value (總價值), in relation to construction operations carried out under a construction contract, means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the contract is not a term contract described in paragraph (a), but a contract under which the construction operations are or form part of any construction operations that are carried out in stages, the aggregate of the values of all stages of the construction operations so carried out; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the value of the construction operations.

def.name: TotalValue
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, total value (總價值), in relation to construction operations that are not carried out under a construction contract, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the construction operations are or form part of any construction operations that are carried out in stages, the aggregate of the values of all stages of the construction operations so carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the value of the construction operations.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this Ordinance, value (價值), in relation to any quarry products, means the value of the quarry products.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may have regard to any or all of the following matters when ascertaining the value of any quarry products—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the type and volume of the quarry products;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the market price of the quarry products at the time of production.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Variation of compensation limits and daily rates for medical expenses
section.leadIn: The Legislative Council may by resolution amend—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any monetary amount specified in the First or Second Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Part II of the Second Schedule.

subsection.content: Where any payment is made by the Board under section 5A to a member of the family of a deceased person, all the rights and remedies of the member of the family with respect to compensation or damages against a third party, if any, whose act or default not connected with pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma has caused or contributed to the death of the deceased person shall, to the extent of the amount of the payment made by the Board, be transferred to and vested in the Board for the benefit of the Fund, and the Board may exercise such rights and remedies either by joining in an action begun by the member of the family against the third party or by instituting separate proceedings. (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 25)

Where the amount of any such compensation or damages to which a member of the deceased’s family is entitled exceeds the amount of any such payment under section 5A made by the Board, nothing in this section shall affect the rights or remedies of the member of the family in respect of the amount of the excess.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Board, in pursuance of the function referred to in section 26(1)(bb), receives from the Government moneys designated as ex gratia payments to persons suffering from pneumoconiosis, the Board shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold the moneys in a separate account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: distribute the moneys in the manner stipulated by the Government from time to time as to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount of any payment;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person to whom any payment should be made;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the conditions subject to which any payment may be made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, invest the moneys as the Board thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Board may deduct from moneys received from the Government under this section its expenses incurred in performing its function under section 26(1)(bb).
Part VI shall not apply to moneys referred to in this section.

section.name: s40C
section.heading: Certificate to be evidence
section.leadIn: A certificate purporting to be issued under section 15, 15B or 24 and to be signed by or for the Commissioner, the Board or the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board as the case may be shall be admissible in evidence without further proof on its production in any court and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until the contrary is proved, it shall be presumed that the certificate is so issued and signed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if admitted in evidence, shall be evidence of the matters stated in the certificate.

section.name: s40D
section.heading: Survival of entitlement to compensation and payment under the Ordinance

subsection.content: Where a person who is entitled to compensation or other payment dies before the issue of a certificate by the Board under section 15B or a determination by the Board under section 12B, the entitlement of that person to compensation or other payment under this Ordinance shall not survive his death, and the legal personal representative of the deceased person shall have no claim to such compensation or other payment.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other law, where a person claiming compensation under section 14(1)(a) dies before the payment of any compensation to which that person is entitled by virtue of a certificate issued by the Board under section 15B, or before the payment of any medical expenses or expenses for medical appliances to which that person is entitled by virtue of a determination made by the Board under section 12B, the legal personal representative of the deceased person shall have no right to payment of such compensation or expenses, and any such amounts shall be payable— (Amended 16 of 2006 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except where paragraph (b) applies, to the members of the deceased person’s family as if they were compensation to which section 17(1) applied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of expenses which were incurred by another person for the benefit of the person claiming compensation or were paid for by another person on his behalf, to that other person. (Replaced 4 of 1996 s. 8)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any law, where a person claiming compensation under section 14(1)(b) dies before the payment of any compensation to which that person is entitled by virtue of a certificate issued by the Board under section 15B, the legal personal representative of the deceased person shall have no right to payment of the compensation, and any such amount shall be dealt with by the Board as if that person had died before the issue of the certificate.
Part III shall apply to any claim by a member of family for an amount referred to in subsection (2) as if such claim were a claim for compensation under section 14(1)(b).

section.name: s40E
section.heading: Payment of medical expenses etc. to other persons

subsection.content: Where a person who is entitled to any medical expenses under section 12 or expenses for the use or supply of medical appliances under section 12A dies before a determination has been made by the Board under section 12B in respect of those expenses, any person who had incurred such expenses for the benefit of the deceased person or had paid for such expenses on his behalf, or any person having a claim against the estate of the deceased person in respect of such expenses, shall be entitled to payment of those expenses by the Board.

A person claiming payment of expenses from the Board under this section shall serve on the Board a request in writing for such payment together with such documentary evidence of his claim as the Board may require.

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 21 days of receipt of a request under subsection (2), determine whether or not the expenses specified in the request are payable under this section and inform the person in writing of the amount, if any, it determines to be payable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a further 7 days, pay from the Fund to the person any amount so determined to be payable.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Compensation not to be assigned, charged or attached
section.content: Compensation shall not be capable of being assigned, charged or attached, and shall not pass to any other person by operation of law nor shall any claim be set off against such compensation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of determining any matter to be determined under this Ordinance, the Board or the Commissioner may require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person claiming compensation or other payment, or the employer or previous employer of such person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the death of a person, any previous employer of the deceased person,

subsection.continued: to provide such particulars as the Board or the Commissioner may think necessary for the purposes of this Ordinance, and particulars under this section shall be provided orally, or in writing, or by the production of documents as the Board or the Commissioner may direct. (Replaced 54 of 1993 s. 37)

subsection.content: Any person or employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails or refuses to provide any particulars required to be provided under this section, or who wilfully and with intent to deceive provides any particulars which are false in any material particular, commits an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended 54 of 1993 s. 37; E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s43
section.heading: Evidence by certificate etc.
section.leadIn: A certificate purporting to be signed by an officer of the Board authorized for the purposes of section 44—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any notice required by or under this Ordinance has or has not been given or has or has not been given at any date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any amount of levy, surcharge, penalty or further penalty due under this Ordinance has not been paid, (Amended 1 of 1983 s. 6)

section.continued: shall be sufficient evidence of that fact until the contrary is proved.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Authentication, and production in evidence of documents

subsection.content: Any notice or other document given or issued by the Board may be signed by an officer of the Board, authorized by the Board for the purposes of this subsection.

Any document purporting to be a notice or other document given or issued by the Board and purporting to be signed by an officer of the Board authorized under subsection (1) shall be received in evidence and shall until the contrary is proved be deemed to be such a notice or other document.

section.name: s45
section.heading: False statements

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with intent to deceive, produces, supplies or sends for the purposes of this Ordinance or otherwise makes use for those purposes of any document or record which is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in providing any information for the purposes of this Ordinance, makes any statement which he knows to be false in a material particular or recklessly makes a statement which is false in a material particular,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 or 20 times the amount of any levy that was or was intended to be evaded by his conduct, whichever is the greater.

subsection.content: Where the Board does not pay compensation or any other payment which it is required by this Ordinance to pay, such compensation or other payment shall be recoverable as a debt due from the Board.

Subject to subsection (3), an action under subsection (1) may be brought in the Court notwithstanding that the amount due exceeds the civil jurisdiction of the Court as may from time to time be determined under the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

Notwithstanding subsection (2), where any amount to be recovered from the Board is within the jurisdiction of the Small Claims Tribunal established under the Small Claims Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 338), an action for the recovery of the amount shall be brought in that Tribunal.
The Chief Justice may make rules regulating proceedings before and appeals to the Court under this Ordinance and for the fees payable in respect of such proceedings and appeals.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for— (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 38)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the assessment of levy, including— (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the notification of construction operations and quarry operations; (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 25)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the notification of payments made in respect of construction operations and quarry products; (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 25)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the imposition and amount of surcharges where there has been a failure to make a notification;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: objections to assessments of levies and the imposition of surcharges and appeals;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the information that is to be supplied by construction employers, contractors, authorized persons or quarry operators; (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 25; 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: prohibiting, subject to such exceptions as may be prescribed, the disclosure of information; (Amended 1 of 1983 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the appointment of authorized persons for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the records that are to be kept by construction employers, contractors and authorized persons or by quarry operators; (Amended 3 of 2004 s. 25; 12 of 2006 s. 84)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribing procedure and fees;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any matter which is to be or may be prescribed;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: generally the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.

editorialNote.content: For transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by 3 of 2004, please see section 40 of the Construction Industry Levy (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2004 (3 of 2004).

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may charge fees for any service provided to the Board by the Government, but except as provided in subsection (2) shall not charge a fee for any service provided in the discharge of a duty under this Ordinance. (Amended 4 of 1996 s. 10)
Fees may be charged under subsection (1) for services provided to the Board by the Government in the discharge of a duty under Part IV. (Added 4 of 1996 s. 10)

section.name: s48
section.heading: Application to deaths prior to commencement of the Pneumoconiosis (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 1986
section.content:
Subject to section 4(2), amendments made by the Pneumoconiosis (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 1986 (15 of 1986) (the amending Ordinance)
shall apply in the case of the death of a person suffering from pneumoconiosis who died from a cause other than pneumoconiosis before the commencement# of the amending Ordinance as they apply in the case of such a death which occurs after such commencement.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Application to claims prior to the 1993 amending Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: amending Ordinance (修訂條例) means the Pneumoconiosis (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (54 of 1993);

Ordinance as amended (經修訂的本條例) means this Ordinance as amended by the amending Ordinance or by any Ordinance coming into operation after the commencement# of the amending Ordinance; (Amended 4 of 1996 s. 11)
Ordinance prior to its amendment (修訂前的本條例) means this Ordinance prior to its amendment by the amending Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, any person who was entitled immediately prior to the commencement of the amending Ordinance to compensation under section 6 of this Ordinance prior to its amendment pursuant to a certificate issued by the Commissioner under section 15 may at any time apply to the Board, in a form approved by the Board, to receive compensation in accordance with section 6 of this Ordinance as amended and other payments for the period beginning from the date of such application, and in the case of compensation under section 6(1)(a) such compensation shall be payable in respect of the difference between— (Amended 4 of 1996 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the degree of the person’s incapacity as determined from time to time for the purposes of this Ordinance as amended; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the degree of his permanent incapacity as assessed for the purposes of this Ordinance prior to its amendment and in respect of which compensation has been paid or is payable at the time of such application pursuant to a certificate issued by the Commissioner under section 15 of this Ordinance prior to its amendment.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application is made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compensation in respect of such degree of permanent incapacity as is referred to in subsection (2)(b) and other payments shall continue to be payable to the person in accordance with this Ordinance prior to its amendment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except as provided in paragraph (a), the whole of the person’s entitlement to compensation or other payment under this Ordinance prior to its amendment shall, by virtue of such application, be extinguished.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in any case where the person is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applicant in appeal proceedings brought under this Ordinance before the commencement of the amending Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: appellant in proceedings further to an appeal brought under this Ordinance before the commencement of the amending Ordinance,

paragraph.continued: where such proceedings are still before the Court;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: to any person who, since a date 6 months after the commencement of the amending Ordinance, in an appeal brought by him under this Ordinance prior to its amendment, has taken any proceeding in furtherance of such appeal, other than a proceeding taken for the purpose of or in connection with the withdrawal of the person’s appeal;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: to any person who, since a date 6 months after the commencement of the amending Ordinance, has taken any step in furtherance of proceedings for damages for death or disability resulting from pneumoconiosis within the meaning of section 13 other than a proceeding taken for the purpose of or in connection with the withdrawal of the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person has applied under subsection (2), the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall determine the degree of the person’s incapacity in accordance with the Fourth Schedule of this Ordinance as amended, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in making such determination the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board may examine the person or may have regard to any examination conducted by it within the preceding 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any such examination shall, for the purpose of section 24 (including the issue of a certificate under section 24(4)), be treated as an examination conducted for the purposes of section 23A.

subsection.leadIn: Except as regards—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 11 of the amending Ordinance as it amends section 13 of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 22 of the amending Ordinance as it adds section 20(7) to (9) of this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: and except as otherwise provided in this section, the amendments made by the amending Ordinance do not apply to any person to whom a certificate had been issued by the Commissioner pursuant to section 12 or 15 prior to the commencement of the amending Ordinance, and the provisions of this Ordinance in force immediately before the commencement of the amending Ordinance shall continue to apply to such person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance as amended, the date of diagnosis of a person who has made an application under subsection (2) shall be deemed to be the date on which such application was made.

An application under subsection (2) made within 6 months after the date of commencement of the amending Ordinance shall, for the purposes of that subsection and subsection (3), be deemed to have been made on the date of commencement of the amending Ordinance.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Transitional provisions in relation to certain construction operations

subsection.leadIn: The amendments to this Ordinance, including its subsidiary legislation, as effected by sections 6 to 25 (except section 13) of Schedule 6 to the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587) (the amendments) do not apply to the following construction operations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: construction operations the tender for which had been submitted to the construction employer before the commencement day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other construction operations carried out under a construction contract, if the contract had been entered into before the commencement day or the construction operations had commenced before the commencement day; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: construction operations other than those referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b), that had commenced before the commencement day.

subsection.content: The pre-amended Ordinance continues to apply to the construction operations referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement day (生效日期) means the day on which sections 6 to 25 of Schedule 6 to the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587) come into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (修訂前的本條例) means this Ordinance, including its subsidiary legislation, as in force immediately before the commencement of the amendments.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Transitionals for Certification for Employee Benefits (Chinese Medicine) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2006

subsection.content: A reference in any provision of this Ordinance to medical treatment given by or under the supervision of a registered Chinese medicine practitioner or to an opinion given by him does not include any treatment or opinion so given before the commencement of the provision of the 2006 Ordinance that amends that provision of this Ordinance.
No provision in section 12AA shall affect the entitlement to any cost of medicines if the medicines were prescribed before the commencement of that provision of section 12AA.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Despite subsection (2), as soon as any provision of section 12AA(4), (5) and (9)(d) and (e) (relevant provision) has commenced, the relevant provision shall apply for the purpose of determining the entitlement to cost of medicines that is incurred on or after the commencement of the relevant provision, regardless of when the medicines are prescribed. (Added 10 of 2008 s. 63)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: In subsections (2) and (2A), the commencement of a provision of section 12AA means the day appointed for the coming into operation of section 25 of the 2006 Ordinance in so far as that section 25 relates to the adding of that provision of section 12AA. (Added 10 of 2008 s. 63)

The amendments made by any provision of the 2006 Ordinance to sections 12B and 28 do not apply to medical expenses and expenses for medical appliances incurred before the commencement of that provision of that Ordinance. Those sections as were in force immediately before that commencement shall continue to apply to those expenses as if those sections had not been amended by that provision of that Ordinance.

subsection.def: In this section, 2006 Ordinance (《2006年條例》) means Part 4 of the Certification for Employee Benefits (Chinese Medicine) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2006 (16 of 2006).

part.name: PI
part.heading: Compensation for Death Resulting from Pneumoconiosis or Mesothelioma (or both)

section.name: s1
section.content: An amount calculated according to the formula—
(Average yearly earnings × Age factor × 55%) × 110%,
rounded up to the nearest $10.

section.name: s2

def.name: AgeFactor
def.leadIn: Age factor (年齡因數) means the multiplier specified in column 2 of the Table below opposite the deceased’s age at the time of his death as shown in column 1—

section.def: Average yearly earnings (每年平均收入) means the average yearly earnings, as defined in Part VII of this Schedule, in the year in which the deceased died.

part.name: PII
part.heading: Compensation for Total Incapacity
part.content: An amount equal to the average monthly earnings as defined in Part VII of this Schedule for the period to which the payment relates, rounded up to the nearest $10.

part.name: PIIA
part.heading: Compensation for Pain, Suffering and Loss of Amenities

part.name: PIII
part.heading: Compensation for Period Prior to Date of Diagnosis

section.name: s1
section.content: An amount calculated according to the formula—
Average monthly earnings × No. of months × Multiplier,
rounded up to the nearest $10. (Replaced 4 of 1996 s. 12)

section.name: s2
section.def: Average monthly earnings (每月平均收入) means the average monthly earnings, as defined in Part VII of this Schedule, for the month of January in the year in which the date of diagnosis falls;

def.name: Multiplier
def.leadIn: Multiplier (乘數) means the percentage specified in column 2 of the Table below opposite the degree of incapacity of the person at the date of diagnosis as shown in column 1—

td.p: more than 30% but not more than 60%

section.def: No. of months (月數) means the number of full months, not exceeding 24, in the period from the earliest diagnosed date to the date of diagnosis.

part.name: PVI
part.heading: Funeral Expenses
part.content: An amount not exceeding $98,950, payable against any sum actually spent for the burial or cremation of the deceased and for any ceremony connected with his burial or cremation.

part.name: PVII
part.heading: Interpretation
part.def: average monthly earnings (每月平均收入) means, in respect of any period, an amount equal to 26 times the overall average daily wage earned by persons or classes of persons engaged in Government building and construction works as ascertained by the Commissioner for Census and Statistics and applicable to 1 January of the year in which the period falls;
average yearly earnings (每年平均收入) means, in respect of any period, an amount equal to 12 times the average monthly earnings for that period.

schedule.name: sch2

section.leadIn: Subject to paragraph 3, where a person is given medical treatment in respect of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) as an in-patient in a hospital, the expenses payable are— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b

section.leadIn: Subject to paragraph 3, where a person is given medical treatment in respect of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) other than as an in-patient in a hospital, the expenses payable are— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total amount of the medical expenses; or

paragraph.name: b

section.continued: whichever total amount is the less.

section.content: Where a person is given medical treatment in respect of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both) on any day both as an in-patient in a hospital and other than as an in-patient in a hospital, the daily rate for the purposes of this Schedule shall be $370.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Incorporation and states
section.content: The Board shall be a body corporate with perpetual succession and capable of suing and being sued.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Status of Board
section.content: The Board shall not act or be treated as the servant or agent of the Crown.

subsection.content: The Board shall have a common seal, the affixing of which shall be authenticated by the signature of any 2 members.
Any document purporting to be a document duly executed under the seal of the Board shall be received in evidence and shall, unless the contrary is proved, be deemed to be a document so executed.
A member of the Board who is not a public officer shall, unless his appointment is terminated or otherwise ceases, hold office for such period as the Chief Executive may specify.

On the expiry of his period of appointment or re-appointment, any member to whom subparagraph (1) applies shall be eligible for re-appointment for such further term as the Chief Executive may specify.

Any member to whom subparagraph (1) applies may at any time resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive, and he shall cease to be a member from the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, from the date of the receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

If any member of the Board, other than the chairman, is absent from Hong Kong or is for any other reason unable to exercise the powers or perform the duties of his office as member, the Chief Executive may appoint another person to be a temporary member in his place during his absence or incapacity.
The Chief Executive shall appoint a member to be chairman of the Board.

If the chairman is absent from Hong Kong or is for any other reason unable to act as chairman, the Chief Executive may appoint another member to be chairman in his place during his absence or incapacity.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Meetings and proceedings of the Board

subsection.content: Meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as the chairman may appoint.
A quorum shall be 5 members.
At any meeting of the Board the chairman shall preside.
If the chairman is absent from any meeting of the Board, the members present at the meeting shall elect one of their number to act as chairman in his place.
The chairman or the member acting in his place shall have a deliberative vote on all matters coming before the Board and in the case of an equality of votes he shall also have a casting vote.

If a member has a pecuniary interest in any matter to be considered at a meeting of the Board and is present at such meeting, he shall as soon as practicable after the commencement of the meeting disclose to the Board the fact and nature of the interest.
Such member shall, if so required by the meeting, withdraw from the meeting while the Board is considering the matter and in any case shall not vote thereon.
Subject to this Schedule, the Board may determine its own procedure at meetings.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transaction of business by circulation of papers
section.content: The Board may transact any of its business by the circulation of papers, and a resolution in writing which is approved in writing by a majority of the members shall be valid and effectual as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Board by the votes of its members so approving the resolution.

subsection.content: Subject to subparagraph (2), the Board may appoint committees for the better discharge of its functions under this Ordinance.

The Board shall appoint a committee, comprising 3 members of the Board, for the purpose of the determination of any objection under regulation 12 of the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) (Assessment of Levy) Regulations (Cap. 360 sub. leg. A). (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 29)

content.leadIn: The Board may in writing delegate to any committee appointed under subparagraph (1) or (2) or to any employee any of its powers and functions:
content.proviso: Provided that no delegation under this subparagraph shall preclude the Board from exercising or performing at any time any power or function so delegated.

subsection.content: Each committee may determine its own procedure at meetings.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Appointment of employees and conditions of employment
section.content: The Board may appoint such employees as it thinks fit and determine all matters relating to their remuneration and terms and conditions of appointment or employment.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant, or make provision for the grant of, pensions, gratuities and retirement benefits, to its employees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide other benefits for the welfare of its employees and their dependants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make payments, whether ex gratia or legally due, to the legal personal representative of a deceased employee or to any person who was dependent on such employee at his death.

subsection.content: The Board may establish, manage and control or enter into an arrangement with any company or association for the establishment, management and control by such company or association either alone or jointly with the Board of any fund or scheme for the purpose of providing for the pensions, gratuities, benefits and payments referred to in subparagraph (1).
The Board may make contribution to any fund or scheme referred to in subparagraph (1) and may require its employees to make contributions thereto.

subsection.def: In this paragraph employees (僱員) includes any class of employee which the Board may specify and in subparagraph (1) includes former employees.

section.name: s1
section.content: The degree of incapacity of a person suffering from pneumoconiosis shall be determined by reference to the person’s loss of lung function resulting from pneumoconiosis, which loss shall, except where paragraph 4 applies, be assessed by reference to the forced vital capacity of the person in accordance with this Schedule.

section.name: s1A
section.leadIn: The degree of incapacity of a person suffering from mesothelioma or from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma shall be determined by reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s loss of lung function resulting from mesothelioma or from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma (as the case may be), which loss shall, except where paragraph 4 applies, be assessed by reference to the forced vital capacity of the person in accordance with this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s loss of other bodily functions (if any) resulting from mesothelioma, which loss shall be assessed by reference to the findings of such other clinical examinations as the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board considers appropriate.

section.name: s2
section.content: Where as a result of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), the forced vital capacity percentage of a person is assessed to be as shown in column 1 of the Table below, the person’s loss of lung function and incapacity shall, subject to paragraph 3, be deemed to be of the degree specified in column 2 and column 3 respectively opposite that forced vital capacity percentage— (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 30)
Table

Degree of loss of
lung function

section.name: s3
section.content: Where the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board is of the opinion, having regard to the findings of any clinical examination relevant to an assessment of a person’s lung function, that the degree of the person’s loss of lung function specified in column 2 of the Table in paragraph 2 opposite his forced vital capacity percentage as assessed for the purposes of that paragraph does not properly represent the actual degree of the person’s loss of lung function as a result of pneumoconiosis or mesothelioma (or both), it may determine the person’s degree of incapacity to be of a degree other than the degree specified in column 3 of the Table opposite that forced vital capacity percentage, but the degree of incapacity so determined shall not be greater than nor less than the degree specified in column 3 of the Table by more than 5 percentage points.

section.name: s4
section.content: Where a person is incapable, by reason of impaired physical condition, of fully taking part in tests that would enable his forced vital capacity percentage to be accurately assessed, the Pneumoconiosis Medical Board shall assess the person’s loss of lung function having regard to the findings of such other clinical examinations as it considers appropriate, and the person’s incapacity shall be deemed to be of the degree specified in column 3 of the Table in paragraph 2 opposite the degree of loss of lung function so assessed.

section.name: s4A
section.content: The degree of incapacity of a person determined in accordance with this Schedule shall not exceed 100%, even though he suffers from both pneumoconiosis and mesothelioma.

section.name: s5
section.def: forced vital capacity percentage (最大肺活量百分率) means the measured value of the forced vital capacity of a person’s lungs expressed as a percentage of the predicted normal value of that capacity of the person.

text.content: 0.15% of the value of the construction operations concerned. (Amended L.N. 132 of 2012)
0.15% of the value of the quarry products concerned. (Amended L.N. 132 of 2012)
